breadcrumb.title: Home
breadcrumb.summary: The UK's largest independent producer of official statistics and the recognised national statistical institute of the UK.

breadcrumb.title: Economy
breadcrumb.summary: An economy or economic system consists of the production, distribution, consumption and trade of limited goods and services by different agents in a given geographical location. The economic agents can be individuals, businesses, organisations, or governments.

breadcrumb.title: Investments, pensions and trusts
breadcrumb.summary: Investment refers to the flow of money around and across countries for the purpose of making profit. A pension is a fixed sum to be paid regularly to a person, typically following retirement and a trust is a legal arrangement where one or more 'trustees' are made legally responsible for holding assets. Statistics here include net flows of investment into the UK, figures on the number of people who hold pensions of different types and investments made by various types of trusts.
